column1: Master in Environmental Science & Climate Change
column5: About this programmeGreen skills are essential for the transition towards a Green Economy. Designed and delivered by expert academics and scientists and in conjunction with local stakeholders, this full-time interdisciplinary programme blends theoretical study with practical, field-based work. You will cover specialist subject areas and gain the skills required to tackle the complex issues associated with the sustainable development of terrestrial and near-coastal ecosystems.
column7: £8,250 per annum International and EU: £14,950 per annum (For 2023, international and EU fees will be the same as Home fees)
